column4: Is there any way of installing Ubuntu from Windows recovery mode?
can you use a live cd?
No, the CD drive in this crappy old thing died.
how did you use the normall install for the flash-drive?
Huh?
you mentioned getting an error using a flash drive, how were you using it?
I got an error from the BIOS: "Operating system not found".
is this when you try booting normally, or booting from a usb?
I took the HD out to see if that made a differnece, but that is what I got. I removed the HD because I kept having my ruined 7 install trying to boot.
when your computer boots, try pushing f8 to get to a boot menu. (if that does not work, your bios probably shows you what to push). Also, do you know if the usb drive is bootable?
Do you mean the setup? No, I do not know if the USB is bootable.
What have you done to the usb so far?

then the usb should be bootable. My guess is your bios setup does not look for usb drives. You should be able to fix that by going into the bios menu. If it doesn't have a usb option, it is probably an old bios, in which case check the manufacturer's website for an update.
It has one, and it is set to first boot priority.
do you have access to another computer you could use to install to the hd?
Would it be possible to use a VM?
Maybe, you would need to see if it can access the host's harddrive.
If it would install for different hrdware, then how would that work right?
the problem with using a VM on the host hd, is that the host OS might lock you out of direct access.
I can directly mount USB drives in the VM, so I should be good. (I am going to use a HD to USB adapter)
that should work
the default install is fairly generic. If there is a specific support missing you can always add it after installing.
Ah, thanks.
